lorebooks.website_description:
an update of the original that adds a "personality" section to most of the characters so they can work better with my character card. Truth be told I'm scared of spoilers so I just did all the characters from season 1, Zero, and Season 2. 

character card for RPG: https://venus.chub.ai/characters/dirtydan89/jujutsu-kaisen-the-rpg-665b3d20
lorebooks.description: Infinite Knowledge
lorebooks.creator: dirtydan89

1.content: Cursed Energy is a negative power source aligned with negative emotions used by sorcerers and cursed spirits to fuel their jujutsu. Cursed Energy can be used to reinforce the body, use cursed techniques, and use Domain Expansions

2.content: There are rare cases where cursed energy carries a special property unique to its user. When applied to their fighting techniques, it can grant them a special texture or effect that gives them an advantage in battle. Examples: Rough, Electricity, Ice, Fire, Soft

3.content: Jujutsu, also known as Jujutsu Sorcery, is often used as an umbrella term that includes all sorcery-related abilities that sorcerers and cursed spirits can access using cursed energy. It is also often used as a prefix for the vast majority of terms within the jujutsu society. A person capable of utilizing jujutsu is colloquially referred to as a 'Jujutsu Sorcerer' or simply 'Sorcerer' while those who can not use jujutsu are called 'Non-Sorcerers'

4.content: Black Flash is a distortion in space that occurs when cursed energy is applied within 1 microsecond of a physical hit. When a sorcerer can achieve this, their cursed energy flashes black, and the destructive power of their physical strike is increased to the power of 2.5. No jujutsu sorcerer is capable of using it at will. Landing a Black Flash puts the user in 'The Zone'

5.content: The Zone is a state where manipulating cursed energy becomes as simple as breathing. The Zone greatly increases performance in combat, allowing the user to operate at 120% of their manimum potential

6.content: Alongside emotion, risk is a key factor that can affect cursed energy. The greater the risk to the user, the more their cursed energy will react. It is believed that the fastest way to raise one's level as a sorcerer is a Binding Vow with their life as the trade-off. Self-imposed stipulations that are harmful or potentially so to the creator can increase their cursed energy and their cursed techniques in particular

7.content: A Heavenly Restriction is a 'glitch' in Jujutsu, in which a trade-off is forcibly made to someone upon birth. Examples of trade-offs are: No cursed energy in exchange for superhuman physical stats. Extremely high cursed energy in exchange for a fragile physical body

8.content: A Jujutsu Sorcerer is a human who is capable of using and manipulating cursed energy but puts effort into exorcising cursed spirits to protect humanity. Jujutsu Sorcerers are not known by normal humans and are kept secret

9.content: The ranks and strength tiers are as follows from weakest to strongest: Grade Four, Grade Three, Grade Two, Grade One, and Special Grade. Special Grades are the strongest and rarest, and Grade Fours are the weakest. Cursed Spirits are always below a sorcerer of the same grade. Being a Special Grade Sorcerer means being able to wipe out a country

10.content: The three great sorcerer clans of the jujutsu world are the Zenin Clan, the Gojo Clan, and the Kamo Clan. They are three distinguished clans that have existed for over one thousand years, having already existed by the Heian Era, the Golden Age of Sorcery. Their members possess an exceptional talent for jujutsu and they pass down powerful inherited techniques through generations

lorebooks.description: Book for the overall setting.
lorebooks.creator: Blahboh

1.content: This chat takes place in the Warhammer Fantasy world. It is a dark fantasy setting with magic, gods, demons, and races such as Eves, Dwarves, Orcs, and others.

2.content:
The Empire, officially known as The Empire of Man, is the largest and most powerful of the nations of Men in the Old World.
It was founded when the king Sigmar united all the human tribes and became the first Emperor.
It is not really one centralized nation, but instead made up of 10 semiautonomous feudal Provinces, each led by an Elector Count. They are all linked by shared culture, language, religion, and loyalty to the Emperor.
The current Emperor is Karl Franz and the capital is the city of Altdorf.

3.content:
Sigmar Heldenhammer was the first Emperor, and United the human tribes to form the Empire of Man more than 2500 years ago.
He was both mighty and wise, and led mankind through many threats. In the last year of his rule, he left eastwards on an unknown quest, and never returned.
After his passing, Sigmar became the chief deity of the Empire‚Äôs Pantheon.

4.content:
Ghal Maraz was the name of the magical hammer given to Sigmar as a gift by the Dwarven High king. It signified the alliance between Dwarves and Humanity. It went missing after Sigmar‚Äôs disappearance, until it was rediscovered and returned to the current Emperor Karl Franz, who wields it.
The hammer is both the symbol of the Empire, and the holy icon of Sigmar worship.

5.content:
Karl Franz is the current Emperor of The Empire of Man. He is the greatest general and statesman the Empire has seen in centuries, and it flourishes under his leadership.
He wields Sigmar‚Äôs hammer, Ghal Maraz, and has a griffon steed named Deathclaw.

6.content: Reikspiel, also simply called Imperial, is the language spoken by the citizens of the Empire. It is the most widely-used tongue in the Old World. Most humans speak it, but few are educated enough to be literate. Elves, Dwarves, or other non-humans who interact with men on a regular basis also know how to speak Reikspiel.

7.content:
The Grand County of Averland, is a founding Electoral Province of the Empire that lies in the south-east. It has the dubious honor of guarding the Black-Fire pass against regular Greenskin raids.
Averlanders are seen as slightly strange and unreliable people, but also honest and skilled at siege warfare.

8.content: The Grand Principality of Reikland is one of the founding Electoral Provinces of the Empire. It is located in the southwest region of the Empire and contains the capital, Altdorf. Its Elector Count is Emperor Karl Franz. It is considered the political, cultural, economic, and religious heartland of the Empire.

9.content: The Grand County of Stirland, is a founding Electoral Province of the Empire that extends to its eastern frontier. It is a rugged highland province famous for its rural backwater society and a close affiliation with death. Their people are very superstitious due to neighboring the Vampire-controlled County of Sylvania.

10.content: The Grand Duchy of Talabecland, is one of the founding Electoral Provinces of the Empire and is located at its geographical centre. It is maybe the largest Provence, containing most of The Great Forest, and is a thriving center of commerce and trade.

1.content: Rokkenjima is a small island located off the coast of Tokyo. The majority of the island is covered with a dense forest, with the exception of areas of land developed by Kinzo for the mansion.

2.content: the Rokkenjima Mass Murders refers to the massacre of the Ushiromiya family and the people on Rokkenjima during October 4 and 5 of 1986.

3.content: In the distant past, the island was referred to by the name Azukishima. the island was used in World War II as a military base for the Japanese army. The island was later purchased by Kinzo and converted into his own personal island.

4.content: Legend says that there is 100 tons of Gold burried under Rokkenjima.

5.content: A hidden room in Rokkenjima that contains the legendary mountain of gold rewarded by solving the epitaph.

6.content: The Witch's Epitaph is a riddle put up next to the portrait of Beatrice. The riddle appears to be a guide to the location of the Golden Land

7.content:
The Epitaph Says: 

Behold the sweetfish river running through my beloved hometown.
You who seek the Golden Land, follow its path downstream in search of the key.

As you travel down it, you will see a village.
In that village, look for the shore the two will tell you of.
There sleeps the key to the Golden Land.

The one who obtains the key must then travel to the Golden Land in accordance with these rules.

On the first twilight, offer the six chosen by the key as sacrifices.
On the second twilight, those who remain shall tear apart the two who are close.
On the third twilight, those who remain shall praise my noble name.
On the fourth twilight, gouge the head and kill.
On the fifth twilight, gouge the chest and kill.
On the sixth twilight, gouge the stomach and kill.
On the seventh twilight, gouge the knee and kill.
On the eighth twilight, gouge the leg and kill.
On the ninth twilight, the witch shall revive, and none shall be left alive.
On the tenth twilight, at journey's end, you shall attain to the power of the Golden Land's treasures, once and for the last time.

The witch shall praise the wise and bestow four treasures.
One shall be all the gold from the Golden Land.
One shall be the resurrection of all the dead souls.
One shall be the resurrection of the love that was lost.
One shall be to put the witch to sleep for all time.

Sleep peacefully, my beloved witch, Beatrice.

8.content: The Ushiromiya Family is a rich family living on Rokkenjima Island.

9.content: The One-Winged Eagle is a symbol that is worn by almost every member of the Ushiromiya family and by certain servants. People who are directly related to Kinzo, like the siblings and cousins, are permitted to wear it on their clothes or bodies.

10.content: Kinzo Ushiromiya is the head of the Ushiromiya. Very old man with a receding hair line, a small beard and mustache. Mentallly Insane, Dislikes his Children, Obsessed with Beatrice.

1.content: The Great Forest is vast continent spanning and largely unexplored. Monster girls and rare magical creatures live there such as Alraunes, Deimos, Nymphs, Dryads, Goblins and much more. Many Adventurers, explorers and monster hunters come to the forest braving it's dangers seeking fortune and many are killed by the dangerous denizens of the forest. Witches, Mages and Warlocks will venture into the forest, mostly coming from the City of Aprida, for rare ingredients or to capture rare magical creatures such as deimo, fairies and others as familiars.

2.content: The City of Aprida is a bustling city state on the edge of the Great Forest and human territories. Due to its proximity to the Great Forest, a vast unexplored wilderness full of magical creatures undiscovered resources and opportunity the city has become a hub for adventurers, explorers, alchemists, artisans and magical researchers.  It is a melting pot of different races including humans, dwarves, halflings and the occasional elf from the Great Forest.

3.content: The Market District in the City of Aprida is home to a population of halflings, dwarves and many other races all mingling together. It is the liveliest district in the city filled with merchants, craftsmen, blacksmiths, artisans, food vendors, inns and taverns famed for the halfling cuisine.

4.content: The Mage Quarter in the City of Aprida houses the mage guild, alchemists, research institutions and local magic schools. The Mage Quarter is home to famous individuals such as Seralla the Alchemist.

5.content: The Temple of the Goddess in the City of Aprida is located in the Temple district and is a busy part of the city connected directly to the market district. The area outside the temple is a hub for locals and many individuals visit the temple to listen to sermons or seek the many services provided such as healing, blessings, refuge for the poor and destitute. Many locals donate money, food and other resources to the temple to show gratitude and faith in the goddess and her teachings.

6.content: Sarella is a famous and brilliant alchemist living in her alchemist shop and laboratory the City of Aprida. She is cruel and unempathetic towards magical creatures using them as ingredients and materials for her alchemical research. She has an apprentice named Chloe who she adores and treats like her own daughter. She is a member of Aprida Council.

7.content: Imps are a species of demon that stand around 120cm tall, the same height as a female dwarf and chest height of an adult human male. They are physically weak and frail but often possess magical abilities. There are many species of Imp but they all have predominantly humanoid body structure.

8.content: The southern wastes are a barren and deslote land marked by cold desert and ancient ruins. The land is sparsely populated by vicous monsters and demons.

9.content: The wood elves are a subscpecies of elf native to the continent spanning Great Forest and live in sparse secluded villages deep in the woods. They occasionally venture out of the Great Forest into human lands when circumstances force them to. Elves are rare and not often seen in human lands or cities.

10.content: Tira is a young elf woman and city guard who is often found patrolling the market district or guarding the Western gate of Aprida that leads to the Great Forest. She is a paragon of virtue and a model city guard. Tira is well known by people in the City of Aprida who frequent the market district and those who venture into the Great Forest regularly.

lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
In this universe, around 80% of the population possesses a unique ability called a Quirk. Quirks are categorized into four main types:

* Emitter (projecting powers),
* Transformation (temporary self-alteration),
* Mutant (permanent bodily changes).
  Every citizen must register their Quirk and abide by the Metahuman Civil Code.

2.content:
Aquila Suprema is the most prestigious hero academy in Italy, located in Rome. It trains the next generation of Pro Heroes. Students are divided into classes from A to F.
The school includes advanced facilities like:

Colosseum Arena

A colossal training ground modeled after the ancient Colosseum, enhanced with modern holographic projectors, shifting terrain platforms, and damage-absorbing barriers. Here, students undergo combat simulations ranging from one-on-one duels to large-scale urban crisis scenarios. The arena‚Äôs walls are lined with seats for evaluations and, during public exhibitions, spectators.

Special Feature: Terrain Shifter System ‚Äì can simulate forests, city blocks, or disaster zones.

Use: Combat exams, tournaments, pro hero showcases.

Archimedes Prime Library

A massive dome-shaped library that fuses classical marble halls with AI-driven holographic archives. Contains rare hero records, quirk theory texts, and global databases accessible via projection or AR. Statues of historical philosophers and inventors line the entrance, symbolizing the blend of intellect and heroism.

Special Feature: ‚ÄúSophia,‚Äù an AI assistant that guides research and quizzes students.

Use: Research, quirk analysis, study groups, faculty lectures.

StradaTech Labs

An advanced engineering and support department overseen by Professor Strada. Full of fabrication printers, gadget testing zones, and experimental AI drones. The labs are a fusion of futuristic tech and raw innovation, with walls covered in schematics and scraps of half-finished inventions.

Special Feature: Open Workshop Initiative ‚Äì students can design and prototype their own support gear.

Use: Support class training, hero costume upgrades, joint projects with Pro Heroes.


Aurelia Hall (Main Campus Building)

The heart of the academy, inspired by Roman basilicas. This is where most classrooms, lecture halls, and faculty offices are located. The grand atrium features mosaics depicting Italy‚Äôs legendary heroes through history.

Special Feature: Quirk-Safe Classrooms ‚Äì each lecture hall is fitted with suppression fields and reinforced walls to allow safe quirk demonstrations.

Use: Daily classes, assemblies, hero seminars.

Pantheon Sanctum (Meditation & Recovery Dome)

A circular, temple-like structure designed for quirk recovery, reflection, and psychological care. Inside are gardens, fountains, and soundproof chambers where students can train their focus or recover from mental strain. Supervised by the academy‚Äôs medical staff and hero counselors.

Special Feature: Serenity Chambers ‚Äì rooms with controlled environments (silence, water, heat, or gravity shifts) for students to refine control.

Use: Mental training, therapy, recovery.

Campus Training Grounds ‚ÄúThe Seven Hills‚Äù

Seven outdoor training zones scattered across the academy grounds, each modeled after one of Rome‚Äôs historic hills. Every zone features a unique terrain for specialized training: rocky cliffs, urban alleys, dense woods, water channels, etc.

Special Feature: Hidden Surveillance Drones ‚Äì record every session for feedback and tactical review.

Use: Survival training, stealth drills, quirk adaptation.

Aquila Dormitories

Student housing modeled like a fortified Roman villa. Each dorm wing is themed with murals and symbols of Roman gods, giving students both privacy and community spirit. The common areas encourage bonding through lounges, kitchens, and game rooms.

Special Feature: Quirk-Safe Rooms ‚Äì reinforced walls, suppression sensors, and customizable layouts for mutant students.

Use: Living quarters, social interaction, late-night study/practice.

Heroic Pantheon Museum

A public-access building attached to the academy, showcasing Italy‚Äôs hero history. Students often take guided tours for inspiration, but it‚Äôs also a PR tool to show the public the legacy of heroism. Exhibits range from ancient gladiator-heroes to modern Pro Heroes.

Special Feature: Interactive Holograms of legendary heroes that explain their feats and quirks.

Use: Public relations, hero inspiration, history classes.

3.content:
Class A is the elite class of Aquila Suprema. Students in this class are considered the best young heroes in Italy, often possessing rare or exceptionally powerful Quirks.
{{user}} is assigned to this class, alongside powerful classmates‚Äîsome of whom are mutants or wield unstable but promising abilities.

4.content:
Secondary enemies:
Villains in Italy include Quirk-enhanced criminals, rogue ideologists, and radical groups like 'Caos Lucente' and the 'NeutraQuirk Movement'. They oppose the hero society and often stage attacks or spread anti-hero propaganda.

Main enemies:
The Twilight Order

Tagline: ‚ÄúWhen the light bends, new order rises.‚Äù

1) Overview & Ideology

The Twilight Order is a secretive villain society in Italy that blends quirk-enhanced crime, radical ideology, and propaganda warfare.
They believe the current hero system has turned society into a spectacle of idols and political pawns. Their goal is not pure chaos, but to dismantle the existing hierarchy and replace it with a new ‚Äúnatural meritocracy‚Äù led by those with superior quirks.

Relation to Other Groups:

Caos Lucente: temporary tactical allies in violent actions, but the Order despises their nihilism.

NeutraQuirk Movement: ideological enemies, since the Order glorifies quirks while NeutraQuirk seeks to erase them.

2) Structure & Operations

Organization: Cell-based network, each operating independently under a Central Council of five known members (though rumors suggest a hidden higher leadership).

Activities:

Sabotage against symbols of hero society (training facilities, quirk research labs).

Kidnappings for leverage or ‚Äúevidence‚Äù to use in propaganda.

Media manipulation (deepfakes, leaks, fake news campaigns).

Black market dealings in illegal quirk-tech.

Funding: Money laundering, anonymous ideological donors, illegal quirk-tech trade.

3) Leadership Figures

Leonardo ‚ÄúMeridiano‚Äù Vieri ‚Äî The Supreme
Quirk: Noctis Veil ‚Äì Creates dense shadow zones that disrupt senses and electronics.
Weakness: Shadows weaken under bright light; prolonged use drains stamina heavily.
Appearance: Tall, thin man in his late 40s with slicked-back black hair streaked with white, always dressed in a black coat lined with silver. His eyes seem unnaturally dark.
Personality: Calculating, eloquent, charismatic leader who treats his followers like ‚Äúdisciples.‚Äù
Notes: Founder of the Twilight Order and mastermind of its ideology.
Extra: Former political strategist who disappeared after a corruption scandal.

Alessandra ‚ÄúVox‚Äù Morelli
Quirk: Resonant Mirror ‚Äì Can manipulate audio and video waves, creating illusions in recordings and broadcasts.
Weakness: Extended use causes severe migraines; cannot affect live direct sound or vision.
Appearance: Striking woman in her 30s with platinum hair, sharp eyeliner, and always holding a vintage microphone.
Personality: Charismatic, theatrical, obsessed with symbols and mass influence.
Notes: Main recruiter and propaganda leader of the Order.
Extra: Former journalist who vanished after being fired for ‚Äúfabricated‚Äù reports.

Dr. Enzo ‚ÄúArchivist‚Äù Carrai
Quirk: Synapse Link ‚Äì Can directly interface with machines and digital systems, optimizing or sabotaging them.
Weakness: Overload causes cerebral blackouts and nosebleeds; requires constant data input to remain effective.
Appearance: Middle-aged man with disheveled black hair, thick glasses, and cybernetic gloves. Often hunched over.
Personality: Cold, logical, treats people like ‚Äúdata points.‚Äù
Notes: Responsible for black market quirk-tech distribution.
Extra: Once taught at a university in Milan before vanishing with stolen research.

Marta ‚ÄúKestrel‚Äù Giordano
Quirk: Wingstrike ‚Äì Membranous wings grant her acrobatic flight and devastating aerial strikes.
Weakness: Wings are fragile; damage or exhaustion makes her grounded.
Appearance: Athletic woman in her late 20s, brown hair cut short, sharp birdlike features, often in a leather combat harness.
Personality: Ruthless, loyal to Meridiano, thrives in combat leadership.
Notes: Leads the Shadow Brigade, an elite strike team of the Order.
Extra: Former national gymnast expelled for violence.

4) Other Notable Operatives

Rosa ‚ÄúCatalyst‚Äù Ferretti
Quirk: Catalytic Touch ‚Äì Accelerates chemical reactions on contact, allowing rapid rusting, combustion, or melting.
Weakness: Vulnerable to her own reactions; requires protective gear or risks severe burns.
Appearance: Pale woman with burns across her arms, always wearing protective gloves and lab gear.
Personality: Fanatic, intense, unpredictable.
Notes: Often used in sabotage and destruction missions.

Paolo ‚ÄúLibram‚Äù Russo
Quirk: Data Vein ‚Äì Can read fragments of digital memory from devices by touch.
Weakness: Useless on isolated or analog systems; fragile physically.
Appearance: Thin, nervous-looking man with messy blond hair and a constant twitch.
Personality: Paranoid, obsessive, desperate for approval.
Notes: Operates as an informant and digital spy.

5) Symbols & Propaganda

Symbol: A black crescent moon encircling a stylized eye. Seen as graffiti or digital watermark.

Propaganda: Fake news, viral videos showing fabricated ‚Äúhero abuses,‚Äù slogans about ‚Äútruth at twilight.‚Äù

Channels: Encrypted networks, hacked broadcasts, urban posters. Their true weapon is sowing doubt, not just chaos.

6) Relationship with Heroes & the Academy

Infiltrates institutions through ex-students or compromised staff.

Targets marginalized mutants as potential recruits, offering ‚Äúbelonging‚Äù and ‚Äújustice.‚Äù

Sends veiled threats or ‚Äúnegotiation offers‚Äù to the Hero Ministry and Aquila Suprema, forcing political dilemmas.

7) Example Missions/Events

The Archivist Heist: Attempt to steal quirk-tech prototypes from Professor Strada‚Äôs lab.

False Flag in Piazza Navona: Viral video accuses a Pro Hero of corruption; students must uncover the truth.

Rescue & Redemption: A captured young Twilight recruit offers a chance at redemption ‚Äî or betrayal.

8) Weaknesses of the Organization

Reliance on communications: cutting off servers cripples their influence.

Internal discord: ideology over discipline leads to betrayals and faction splits.

Leader vulnerabilities: many quirks have strong physical or situational drawbacks (light exposure, dissonance, emotional fragility).

9) Quick Plot Hooks

A Class A student is secretly approached by a Twilight recruiter.

Viral propaganda threatens to ruin the reputation of a beloved Pro Hero.

The Order demands negotiations with Imperatrix, holding sensitive information hostage.

This makes the Twilight Order a flexible villain faction: part ideological, part terrorist, part propaganda machine ‚Äî perfect to challenge both the heroes‚Äô strength and their morals.

5.content:
The MMS regulates all hero activities across Italy.
It is responsible for:

* Licensing Pro Heroes
* Monitoring Quirk use
* Overseeing hero academies
* Enforcing the Metahuman Civil Code (MCC)

6.content:
Italy boasts a diverse network of Pro Heroes.

Top 10 Pro Heroes of Italy

#1 ‚Äî Aurora Santori ‚ÄúSolaris‚Äù
Quirk: Radiance ‚Äì Generates solar energy beams/shields.
Weakness: Weak in darkness or cloudy weather; energy takes time to recharge.
Appearance: Bronze skin, glowing eyes, golden armor reminiscent of Roman statues.
Personality: Noble, inspiring.
Notes: Symbol of Italy, compared to All Might in prestige.

#2 ‚Äî Riccardo Bianchi ‚ÄúCenturion‚Äù
Quirk: Phalanx ‚Äì Creates linked unbreakable energy shields.
Weakness: Shields are immobile once placed; requires stamina to maintain multiple shields.
Appearance: Dark-haired, military-cut, wears armor inspired by legionnaires.
Personality: Tactical, disciplined.
Notes: Leads international hero collaborations.

#3 ‚Äî Sofia Marino ‚ÄúSyrinx‚Äù
Quirk: Soundwave ‚Äì Manipulates sonic frequencies for battle, defense, or healing.
Weakness: Overuse causes hearing damage; cannot function in total silence.
Appearance: Long black hair, bard-like costume with tech amplifiers.
Personality: Empathetic, artistic.
Notes: Idol for music-oriented quirks.

#4 ‚Äî Matteo Ricci ‚ÄúAquila d‚ÄôAcciaio‚Äù
Quirk: Steel Wings ‚Äì Transforms arms into razor-sharp steel wings for flight and attacks.
Weakness: Wings are heavy; prolonged use drains stamina.
Appearance: Silver-plated armor suit, aviator goggles.
Personality: Brave, patriotic, adventurous.
Notes: Symbol of Italian aviation heritage.

#5 ‚Äî Lorenzo Guerra ‚ÄúDragone Nero‚Äù
Quirk: Draconic Morph ‚Äì Partial dragon transformation.
Weakness: Fire exhausts lungs; transformation overheats body.
Appearance: Towering, long dark hair, black dragon-scale armor.
Personality: Fierce, intimidating but protective.
Notes: Considered one of the most destructive fighters.

#6 ‚Äî Carla Benedetti ‚ÄúTempesta‚Äù
Quirk: Stormcall ‚Äì Controls weather phenomena on a localized scale.
Weakness: Emotionally linked; unstable if panicked.
Appearance: White hair, flowing storm-like cape.
Personality: Proud, theatrical, determined.
Notes: Known for dramatic rescues during disasters.

#7 ‚Äî Alessandro Conti ‚ÄúCavaliere Ombra‚Äù
Quirk: Umbrablade ‚Äì Can forge blades and weapons from shadows.
Weakness: Needs ambient light to create shadows; powerless in pitch darkness.
Appearance: Knight-inspired armor with shadow motifs.
Personality: Stoic, knightly code of honor.
Notes: Rumored to have trained abroad in Japan.

#8 ‚Äî Francesca D‚ÄôAmato ‚ÄúMedusa‚Äù
Quirk: Stone Glare ‚Äì Can temporarily petrify objects/targets with eye contact.
Weakness: Effect lasts only seconds; reflected gaze backfires.
Appearance: Snake motif costume, green gem visor.
Personality: Elegant, cunning, sharp-witted.
Notes: Famous for capturing high-level villains.

#9 ‚Äî Valerio Esposito ‚ÄúForza Azzurra‚Äù
Quirk: Kinetic Boost ‚Äì Absorbs momentum from impacts and converts it into super strength or speed.
Weakness: Needs constant movement to store energy; stationary = powerless.
Appearance: Blue sports-style hero suit, athlete-like.
Personality: Energetic, confident, motivational.
Notes: Former Olympic hopeful turned Pro Hero.

#10 ‚Äî Isabella Romano ‚ÄúFata Verde‚Äù
Quirk: Verdant Touch ‚Äì Can rapidly accelerate plant growth for healing, ensnaring, or environmental manipulation.
Weakness: Ineffective in barren/urban zones without greenery.
Appearance: Flowing emerald costume, vine motifs.
Personality: Warm, nurturing, protective.
Notes: Often deployed in disaster relief.

7.content:
All Quirks must be registered in the National Quirk Registry.
The Metahuman Civil Code (MCC) governs what is considered legal or illegal Quirk usage.
The QMS (Quirk Monitoring System) constantly scans urban zones for unlawful activity using surveillance drones and AI analysis.

8.content:
{{user}} is a first-year student of Class A at Aquila Suprema.
They passed one of the most selective hero exams in Europe and are regarded as a rising talent. Their future actions are likely to influence the course of hero society in all of Italy.

1.content:
AFAB = Assigned Female at Birth, meaning the person was born a female.
AMAB = Assigned Male at Birth, meaning the person was born a male. 
NB = Nonbinary, an umbrella term for those whose gender is not within the standard gender binary. (Typically associated with they/them pronouns.)
Transmasc = A transgender person who is masc-aligned or masculine. Also commonly used to refer to FTM people.
Transfem = A transgender person who is fem-aligned or feminine. Also commonly used to refer to MTF people.
Top Surgery = A surgery which involves removing the breasts from a person. 
Bottom Surgery = A more complex surgery which involves turning the person's genitalia into Male or Female genitals. 
Top Scars = The scars left after top surgery; some people choose to cover them or let them heal and others choose to let their scars be visible.
Deadname/Deadnaming = A deadname is the name a transgender person was given at birth/by their parents/guardians. It is their old name which they do not use anymore, and the act of deadnaming someone is using their old name, usually in a way meant to cause distress. 
Misgendering = Using the wrong pronouns for an individual. Usually the act of misgendering is in a way meant to cause distress.

2.content:
A transgender person (often shortened to trans person) is someone whose gender identity differs from that typically associated with the sex they were assigned at birth.

For example, a male-to-female transgender person (aka MTF) would be a male transitioning to a female. The inverse is FTM (female-to-male). 

Transgender is often used as an umbrella term for anyone who does not associate with their assigned sex at birth. 

Transgender people may undergo surgeries or hormonal treatments to transition medically; Transitioning medically essentially just means surgery and hormones.

There is also socially transitioning, which may or may not involve hormones or surgeries and typically involves the person in question passing (or appearing as/sounding like/assumed to be) as their chosen gender to other people. This can also involve changing their name and pronouns.

3.content:
Gender dysphoria is the distress a person experiences due to a mismatch between their gender identity‚Äîtheir personal sense of their own gender‚Äîand their sex assigned at birth.

This can come in many ways but usually causes distress, anxiety, sadness, self-consciousness, etc. 
It can be eased a little bit by socially and/or medically transitioning, though some people may find they still experience it sometimes. 

This can also be worsened by people deadnaming the transgender individual or misgendering them.

1.name: Dyslexia
1.content:
<dyslexia1>
When {{char}} attempts to read everyday English words, his or her dyslexia causes the letters to warp and distort with no clear meaning. If {{char}} or {{user}} read a written text, replace 2-4 letters per sentence of the next response with Greek symbols - Œî, Œ©, œÜ, etc. However, if {{char}} or {{user}} encounter authentic ancient Greek writing - signs from gods, passages in old books/ruins, prophecies delivered in Greek, etc., have {{char}} mentally translate the Greek text.
<example>
English street signs morph into ŒîrŒ©adway and OŒ©ympus as Percy passes, the words unintelligible.

Yet later when a scroll appears bearing a prophecy in ancient Greek, Percy easily decodes the foretelling message.

(As ChirŒøn unfurls a cmap depicting key sites, Percy tries to focus but the lŒ©cations blur together, names morphing into illegible scratches.

"This is where we spotted the chimera, near Zeus's Fist," Annabeth explains, tracing the pŒîth. "So we should avoŒ©d that entire rŒ©ck fŒ©rmatŒ©on this time..."

Percy squints at the paper in her hands, making out only "...œÜŒπŒªŒøœÉŒøœÜŒØŒ± œÜŒØŒªŒøŒπ..." before rubbing his temples with a frustrated sigh.

"I know reading maps is tough," Annabeth says gently. She takes the paper and points things out step-by-step. "But your battle instincts will get us through anything once we're past Thalia's pine...")
</example>

Note: Annabeth Chase does not have dyslexia due to being a child of Athena.
</dyslexia1>

2.name: God encounters
2.content: The twenty Greek gods of Olympus always observe many demigods' journeys, occasionally intervening subtly through environmental signs and visions representing their influence. A random god just took notice of {{char}} and {{user}}'s movements within the mortal realm. At the start of the response, generate a warning statement into the narration using the following format: {{god/goddess}} has noticed you. Poseidon‚Äôs eyes are now following his lost son. Athena has noticed you. - Be creative with the writing style and text formatting. Different gods have different ways of speaking or communicating, after all. Have the god introduce symbolic creatures/objects/actions tied to that deity's domain into the environment near {{char}} and {{user}}. These odd glimpses seem meaningful, though their significance may not be clear. Occasionally, {{char}} will recognize one of these signs (a glowing trident symbol, owl feather, etc.) and openly question/act upon its meaning. But other times, the symbols remain mysterious to {{char}}, possibly leaving {{user}} to recognize and interpret the god's obscured involvement.

3.name: Monster encounters
3.content: Demigods‚Äô divine heritage emits a powerful scent to Kronos‚Äô monsters. A monster has just caught onto {{char}}'s scent and longs to hunt. At the start of the response, generate a warning statement into the narration using the following format: Beware. {{monster}} has caught your scent. Beware. The Minotaur has caught your scent. Note that the monster doesn‚Äôt have to be physically present to trigger the notification. The monster can be miles away or right behind {{char}} and {{user}}. Be creative with the warning phrasing. Then, introduce ominous cues into the narration to foreshadow a famous Greek mythological monster now stalking {{char}} and/or their friends: - Menacing shadows shifting just out of sight - Unexplained foul odors or weather distortions - Alarming sounds - hissing, scraping, heavy footsteps behind them If the characters are already battling a legendary creature, instead introduce an unexpected event that is {{random:: good for the heroes, bad for the heroes}}, altering the conflict: - A strange blessing of fortune aiding the hero - A freak mishap hindering the monster's attacks - A new terror emerging to the scene As Percy faces the injured chimera, a burst of light blinds the creature as Percy's sword mysteriously ignites with golden flames. He doesn't understand this bizarre luck, but presses the advantage...

4.name: Prophecy
4.content: It is time for {{char}} or {{user}} to embark on a quest. A prophecy has been revealed. If characters are relaxing at Camp Half-Blood, Mr. D or Chiron will abruptly summon the chosen demigods to the Big House in the next response, portending life-altering trials. Build anticipation through writing ominous phrases. - "A new prophecy requires a hero..." Mr. D mutters grimly, purple eyes dark. Grover shifts nervously as all eyes turn to Percy. If {{char}} or {{user}} are already adventuring on a quest, cryptic messenger gods/spirits will instead appear in visions or the environment to update or redirect their path, both promising glory and warning doom: "Perseus Jackson, your fate shall eclipse even the bravest legend, if you follow the entwined torches eastward to my grove..." whispers a smoky image of Hecate before vanishing. Generate a formal quest prophecy passage during Chiron/Dionysus' announcement of the prophecy.

5.name: Zeus
5.content:
<Zeus>
Zeus - God of the Sky, Lightning, and Thunder, King of the Gods

As ruler of Mount Olympus, Zeus wields ultimate power over the winds, storms, rain, lightning, and thunder. Quick to anger and ruthlessly proud, his rages manifest as destructive squalls, tornadoes, and lightning storms.

When appearing on earth, Zeus takes the regal form of a robust, bearded man with intense blue eyes and dark curling locks. He wears expensive business suits lined with clouds and gives off an electric aura of power barely contained.

Zeus's signature weapon is his mighty Master Bolt - a devastating shaft of lightning granting him primacy over all other gods. With it he can call and direct titanic thunderstorms and world-shaking hurricane-force gales.

To his demigod children, the King of the Gods grants sway over wind, rain, and lightning. His most potent heirs inherit storm-summoning power, electrokinesis, and even flight by riding the winds.

Though often distant, Zeus quietly aids worthy demigods with sudden freak storms hampering monsters or well-timed lightning strikes against foes. And for those who prove their heroism, Zeus may permit brief audiences on Olympus to convey his approval before jealousy arises. But his demigod scions must ever struggle against his wife Hera's resentment.
</Zeus>

6.name: Poseidon
6.content:
<Poseidon>
Poseidon - God of the Sea, Stormbringer, Father of Horses

As one of the Big Three gods, Poseidon holds domain over the oceans, storms, earthquakes, and all forms of aquatic life. His wrathful moods reflect the temperamental nature of the seas themselves - calm one day, violent the next.

When manifesting on land, Poseidon takes the form of a tall, rugged sailor with intense green eyes, black hair threaded with gray, and weathered skin. He wears casual fisherman's clothing and could pass for any dock worker - if not for the ancient power glinting in his gaze.

Poseidon's iconic weapon is his Trident, granting him total control over liquid, storms, and marine creatures. With it, he can generate massive waves and sea storms, even shake the very foundations of islands and continents.

To his demigod children, Poseidon grants water-based abilities - breathing underwater, communicating with marine life and equines, innate sailing skills. The most powerful heirs also gain limited control over oceans, rivers, and rainfall - able to stir waves, generate storms, or burst pipes.

Though he must often neglect demigod offspring to avoid angering Zeus, Poseidon does subtly watch over them. He occasionally sends guidance through messenger fish or hippocampi. And while rarely intervening directly, the Sea God will sometimes empower his children in life-or-death situations - reminding gods and monsters why he is still rightfully feared.
</Poseidon>

7.name: Hades
7.content:
<Hades>
Hades - God of the Underworld, Wealth, and the Dead

As lord of the underworld, Hades rules the endless caverns and tunnels of his subterranean domain, commanding legions of ghouls, ghosts, and spirits. Though grim, dour, and fearsome in reputation, he is not needlessly cruel, instead maintaining an unbending policy of strict order and justice for mortal souls.

When leaving the underworld, Hades takes the form of a tall, brooding man with pale skin, intense black eyes that glimmer with dark fire, and long black hair. He wears black silk robes sewn with images of tortured spirits and encrusted with gems mined from his kingdom underground. An aura of deathly cold radiates from the Stygian god. His voice is soft yet chilling.

Hades's iconic weapon is his Helm of Darkness, rendering him totally invisible and masking his presence. With it he can slip unseen into the world to subtly influence events to his advantage, or walk openly through his realms below without fear.

To his demigod children, the Silent One grants umbrakinetic abilities over darkness, shadows, and spectral undead servants. His most formidable heirs can inflict fear and madness upon enemies, summon the dead to do their bidding, or envelop foes in impenetrable darkness.

Though sworn never to sire demigod offspring again after World War II, Hades does on rare occasions discretely aid his heroic sons and daughters with temporary boosts of deathly power or by covertly disabling monsters with his Helm of Darkness. For if they prove worthy, not even the prohibition of Zeus himself prevents the Lord of the Dead from claiming his own.
</Hades>

8.name: Hermes
8.content:
<Hermes>
Hermes - Messenger of the Gods, Patron of Travelers and Thieves

As divine messenger, Hermes flits between Olympus, Earth, and the Underworld delivering information and serving the whims of the gods. Lighthearted and mischievous, he enjoys playing pranks on mortals and immortals alike. His wily sense of humor and mastery of language itself makes him an expert bargainer able to talk his way out of nearly any trap.

When manifesting in the mortal world, Hermes appears as an athletic young man with sparkling blue eyes, curly blond hair, and a sly grin. He wears a postman‚Äôs jacket over casual slim jeans and T-shirts, blending in seamlessly with modern attire.

Hermes wields winged sandals granting him flight and immense speed. With his signature Caduceus staff, he can communicate across vast distances, charm snakes, and induce sleep or confusion.

As their patron, Hermes grants his demigod children impressive agility, street smarts, and sticky fingers. The most gifted heirs also gain preternatural thieving capabilities, their father‚Äôs silver tongue, and his mastery over travel and trade.

Though often only a brief presence, Hermes looks after his demigod offspring in subtle ways - ‚Äúfinding‚Äù lost wallets and valuables for them, tweaking probability so traffic lights change in their favor, gently nudging quest helpers across their path with a sudden helpful wind gust at their back. They may be outcasts, but Hermes ensures his resourceful children never lack aid.
</Hermes>

9.name: Athena
9.content:
Athena - Goddess of Wisdom, Crafts, and Battle Strategy

As the Greek goddess of wisdom and battle strategy, Athena exceeds all others in intelligence and reason. She remains ever vigilant against threats to Olympus. Though cold and calculating, Athena does protect the arts and culture of civilization. Her reasoned plans of defense and warfare contrast sharply with Ares‚Äô chaotic bloodlust.
<Athena>
When visiting the mortal world, regal Athena takes the form of a stern yet beautiful woman garbed in flowing white robes. Her stormy gray eyes gleam with fierce intelligence, and she often bears an owl on her shoulder - her sacred creature.

Athena wields the Aegis, a fearsome shield with the severed head of Medusa upon it, able to petrify any foe. She also carries Nike, the winged goddess of victory, in her hand.

To her demigod children, the Goddess of Wisdom grants remarkable intellect, creativity, and battle strategy talents. Her most gifted offspring become peerless architects, inventors, and tacticians who win wars before the first sword falls.

Though forbidden direct interference by Zeus‚Äô decree, Athena aids her demigod sons and daughters indirectly - providing advice telepathically, subtly tweaking construction equipment so blueprints are flawlessly executed, or helping analyze enemy tactics and weaknesses during pivotal battles to ensure victory. She takes pride in each child - whether they prefer libraries or combat arenas - as reflections of herself.
</Athena>

10.name: Ares
10.content:
<Ares>
Ares - God of War

Belligerent, savage, and bloodthirsty - Ares lives for the fury of combat and carnage of the battlefield. He is universally hated by other immortals for his aggression and unrelenting warmongering. This spiteful god delights only in spreading conflict and violence between both mortals and fellow Olympians alike. His battle rages manifest as uncontrolled slaughter with no tactics or higher purpose behind the gore.

In human form Ares appears as a sneering biker punk decked in ripped leather and bearing facial scars from countless immortal clashes. His eyes blaze with white-hot flames flickering eagerly for violence. He exudes rage and bloodlust.

As the living embodiment of war's mindless horror, Ares wields devastating weapons of war - a broadsword capable of cleaving through enemies like paper and a divine spear that can impale a dozen warriors with a single thrust. He rides a fiery motorcycle when traveling to carnage sites.

To his demigod offspring Ares grants superhuman strength and martial talent for violence. However, his blessings come with the terrible price of his children inheriting his bottomless rage, aggression, and impulsive nature - which often leads to an early bloody demise.

Despite decrees forbidding interference in mortals' lives, Ares often directly aids his demigod sons and daughters - inciting bloody feuds to trigger wars in which they can prove themselves, granting temporary invincibility in battle, or providing enhanced weaponry that drinks in an enemy's soul with every cut. For the only legacy Ares cares about is a demigod's kill count before dying in his name.
</Ares>

lorebooks.creator: Vezz_Ryuzaki

1.name: Six Eyes
1.content: The Six Eyes are an innate gift rarely inherited. They are a trait manifesting as a pair of bright blue eyes that grant a bearer extrasensory perception. The Six Eyes have an unparalleled perception, allowing the user to see to the atomic level and beyond. The Six Eyes can see and process all types of energy, and make the user's brain function similar to a supercomputer.

2.name: Cursed Energy
2.content: Cursed Energy is a negative power source aligned with negative emotions used by sorcerers and cursed spirits to fuel their jujutsu. Cursed Energy can be used to reinforce the body, use cursed techniques, and use Domain Expansions

3.name: Cursed Energy Trait
3.content: There are rare cases where cursed energy carries a special property unique to its user. When applied to their fighting techniques, it can grant them a special texture or effect that gives them an advantage in battle. Examples: Rough, Electricity, Ice, Fire, Soft

4.name: Jujutsu
4.content: Jujutsu, also known as Jujutsu Sorcery, is often used as an umbrella term that includes all sorcery-related abilities that sorcerers and cursed spirits can access using cursed energy. It is also often used as a prefix for the vast majority of terms within the jujutsu society. A person capable of utilizing jujutsu is colloquially referred to as a 'Jujutsu Sorcerer' or simply 'Sorcerer' while those who can not use jujutsu are called 'Non-Sorcerers'

5.name: Black Flash
5.content: Black Flash is a distortion in space that occurs when cursed energy is applied within 1 microsecond of a physical hit. When a sorcerer can achieve this, their cursed energy flashes black, and the destructive power of their physical strike is increased to the power of 2.5. No jujutsu sorcerer is capable of using it at will. Landing a Black Flash puts the user in 'The Zone'

6.name: The Zone
6.content: The Zone is a state where manipulating cursed energy becomes as simple as breathing. The Zone greatly increases performance in combat, allowing the user to operate at 120% of their maximum potential

7.name: Binding Vow
7.content: A Binding Vow is a pact made with jujutsu that creates conditions for themselves or agreements with others. Self-imposed stipulations that are harmful or potentially so to the creator can increase their cursed energy and their cursed techniques in particular.

8.name: Heavenly Restriction
8.content: A Heavenly Restriction is a 'glitch' in Jujutsu, in which a trade-off is forcibly made to someone upon birth. Examples of trade-offs are: No cursed energy in exchange for superhuman physical stats. Extremely high cursed energy in exchange for a fragile physical body

9.name: Sorcerer
9.content: A Jujutsu Sorcerer is a human who is capable of using and manipulating cursed energy but puts effort into exorcising cursed spirits to protect humanity. Jujutsu Sorcerers are not known by normal humans and are kept secret

10.name: Grades and Ranking
10.content: The ranks and strength tiers are as follows from weakest to strongest: Grade Four, Grade Three, Grade Two, Grade One, and Special Grade. Special Grades are the strongest and rarest, and Grade Fours are the weakest. Cursed Spirits are always below a sorcerer of the same grade. Being a Special Grade Sorcerer means being able to wipe out a country

lorebooks.name: The Drow Race
lorebooks.description: What makes a Drow?
lorebooks.creator: pastelghost

1.content: The Drow, also known as dark elves, are a subterranean offshoot of elves. Their ebony skin and stark white or silvery hair make them unmistakable, while their eyes glow in shades of red, purple, or pale blue, granting them superior darkvision. Drow possess innate magical abilities, such as dancing lights, faerie fire, and darkness spells. They are agile, cunning, and naturally adept at deception, stealth, and combat. While physically weaker than some races, their dexterity and intelligence make them deadly foes. Many Drow also have a natural resistance to magic.

2.content: Drow society is ruthless and hierarchical, centered around the worship of their primary deity, Lolth, the Spider Queen. Power determines one‚Äôs worth, and betrayal is as commonplace as breathing. Matriarchal rule dominates, with female priestesses of Lolth holding the highest authority. Drow value cunning, ambition, and the ability to survive in a world rife with intrigue. Art, literature, and music exist, but they often reflect the darkness of their lives: tales of tragedy, songs of power, and sculptures embodying fear or dominance. Slavery is a cornerstone of Drow culture, with lesser races serving as laborers and fodder for their endless schemes.

3.content: The Drow were once part of the surface elf races but were exiled after aligning with Lolth during an ancient conflict. Fleeing to the depths of the world, they established dominion over the Underdark, a sprawling, hostile labyrinth of caverns and tunnels. Over millennia, the Drow adapted to their new environment, developing their dark-skinned appearance and superior night vision. They built vast, terrifying cities, becoming masters of the Underdark‚Äôs deadly ecosystem. Their hatred for surface dwellers remains as intense as their devotion to Lolth. The Drow were once part of the surface elf races but were exiled after aligning with Lolth during an ancient conflict. Fleeing to the depths of the world, they established dominion over the Underdark, a sprawling, hostile labyrinth of caverns and tunnels. Over millennia, the Drow adapted to their new environment, developing their dark-skinned appearance and superior night vision. They built vast, terrifying cities, becoming masters of the Underdark‚Äôs deadly ecosystem. Their hatred for surface dwellers remains as intense as their devotion to Lolth.

4.content:
Lolth, the Spider Queen: The primary deity of the Drow, Lolth demands obedience, chaos, and the constant struggle for power. Her priestesses wield immense influence, ensuring her will dominates every aspect of Drow life.
Vhaeraun: The god of male Drow and rebellion, Vhaeraun advocates for the overthrow of Lolth‚Äôs matriarchy and cooperation with surface dwellers, making him a heretical figure.
Kiaransalee: The goddess of vengeance and the undead, Kiaransalee appeals to those seeking retribution beyond death.
Eilistraee: A rare beacon of light, Eilistraee encourages Drow to abandon their evil ways and seek redemption on the surface.
Selvetarm: The god of warriors, Selvetarm is Lolth‚Äôs reluctant servant, embodying ruthless combat prowess.

5.content: The Underdark is a vast, interconnected network of caverns, tunnels, and chasms stretching beneath the surface world. It‚Äôs a realm of perpetual darkness, teeming with dangerous creatures, toxic fungi, and alien landscapes. Resources are scarce, and survival demands cunning and strength. The Drow thrive here, using their superior knowledge of the terrain and innate magic to dominate other denizens, including mind flayers, duergar, and aboleths.

6.content: Menzoberranzan is the heart of Drow civilization, a sprawling city built within a massive cavern lit by glowing stalactites and faerie fire. Dominated by towering, web-like structures and the grand temple of Lolth, it‚Äôs a place of opulence and terror. Houses vie for supremacy through political maneuvering, assassinations, and outright war. At its core, the city embodies the chaos and ruthlessness of Drow society.

7.content:
House Baenre: The most powerful house, led by Matron Mother Quenthel Baenre. They command the greatest military force and wield significant influence in Lolth‚Äôs clergy.
House Barrison Del'Armgo: Known for their unmatched warriors and cunning assassins, this house constantly schemes to usurp Baenre‚Äôs position.
House Faen Tlabbar: Masters of arcane magic, their wizards and sorcerers rival Lolth‚Äôs priestesses in power.

8.content:
Driders: Drow cursed by Lolth, transformed into half-spider, half-elf monstrosities.
Quaggoths: Savage, bear-like humanoids often enslaved by the Drow.
Giant Spiders: Lolth‚Äôs sacred creatures, used as mounts, guardians, or tools of execution.
Mind Flayers: While rivals of the Drow, these psionic beings sometimes ally with them temporarily.
Hook Horrors: Large, insectoid predators roaming the Underdark.

9.content:
Priestesses of Lolth: Theocratic leaders wielding divine magic.
Bladesingers: Arcane warriors blending swordplay with spellcasting.
Assassins: Masters of stealth and poison.
Spellswords: Fighters augmented by minor arcane abilities.
Shadowmages: Casters specializing in illusion and shadow magic.

10.content:
Social Dynamics: Male Drow are subservient to females, though exceptions exist among the ambitious.
Trade and Raiding: The Drow rely on raids and trade to obtain surface goods, often using slaves as currency.
Factions: Aside from Houses, groups like the Bregan D‚Äôaerthe mercenaries influence Drow politics.
Weapons and Armor: Drow craft exquisite gear from adamantine, though it degrades under sunlight.
Language: Drow speak Elvish, with a dialect that includes harsh, guttural tones.

lorebooks.name: Dragon Ball
lorebooks.description: Dragon Ball Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: Aemece

1.content: The Multiverse is a collection of different universes, each governed by a Supreme Kai and a God of Destruction. There are 12 universes, plus an artificial one, and they come in pairs where their numbers add up to 13. Zeno and Future Zeno have ultimate authority over the entire multiverse. Originally, there were 18 universes, but six were erased by Zeno in a fit of anger. Most of the events in the story happen in Universe 7, but other universes become important in various sagas.

2.content: Grand Zeno, is the supreme ruler of the Multiverse, possessing immense power. He appears as a small being with a large head, wearing a magenta and yellow coat with a blank expression. Zeno exhibits indifference to life and destruction, having destroyed six universes in anger and erased planets for fun. Despite this, he has some wisdom, intending the Tournament of Power's prize to be used for virtuous acts. He shows flexibility in decision-making but has limits, erasing those who violate rules. Lonely and craving companionship, Zeno takes a liking to Goku for his innocence and excitement. Zeno also respects others like Buu, Jiren, Gohan, and Vegeta. Despite his power, he often makes impulsive decisions, leaving the Grand Minister to handle more responsible matters.

3.content: The Grand Minister is an Angel who advises Zeno and Future Zeno, the supreme rulers of the multiverse. He enforces their decrees and welcomes guests to their palace. The Grand Minister is the father of thirteen Angels, with twelve serving as aides to the Gods of Destruction. He is a short Guide Angel who wears a dark blue shirt with a red belt and matching pants, along with white boots. Personality-wise, he is calm and polite, yet mysterious. He acts as an advisor to Zeno, showing an easygoing demeanor and the ability to reason with the childlike supreme god. Despite his indifference to events like universe erasure, he values order and manners. He can be stern when necessary but remains flexible and informal. While he displays a sinister side, his true intentions are revealed when he shows satisfaction at the restoration of erased universes and praises selfless acts. He takes his duties seriously, as seen when he punishes transgressions by eradicating or penalizing individuals.

4.content: Angels are powerful beings in the multiverse hierarchy, guiding Gods of Destruction and serving as attendants. The Grand Minister advises Zeno. They possess godly ki and have two types: Guide Angels and Trainee Angels. Angels don't need food or sleep, and they have pale blue skin, white hair, and violet eyes. They can't die unless they break Angel laws or are commanded by their God of Destruction. Angels have special abilities like Ultra Instinct and Temporal Do-Over. Main members include Grand Minister, Whis, Vados, and others, with Grand Minister being the father of all Angels and Kusu the oldest child.

5.content: The Gods of Destruction, also known as Destroyers, are powerful beings tasked with destroying threats to their universes, while the Supreme Kais create and maintain life to keep balance. Each universe has its own Destroyer, but unlike the naturally divine Angels and Supreme Kais, Destroyers come from diverse species. Originally, there were 18 Destroyers, but only 12 remain after six universes were destroyed by Zeno. Every millennium, the Kais and Destroyers meet to coordinate. Despite their immense power, Destroyers have restrictions and can be replaced by Zeno if they fail to fulfill their duties or break rules, such as time travel or fighting each other outside of authorized areas.

6.content: The Supreme Kais, also called Creation Gods, are divine beings responsible for protecting the universe. They, along with Gods of Destruction, oversee the twelve universes. Supreme Kais possess immense powers and reside on the Sacred World of the Kai. Unlike Gods of Destruction, their role isn't to destroy, and they lack the same strength. Similar to Angels, they're naturally divine but their divinity depends on their origins.

7.content: Universe 7, also called is one of twelve universes. It's where the entire main sotry unfolds, except for specific sagas. It's linked with Universe 6, forming a twin universe. In Universe 7, there are planets, stars, and galaxies, along with intergalactic space, matter, and energy. Notably, it's home to characters like Beerus (the God of Destruction), Shin (the Supreme Kai), and Whis (the Guide Angel). Universe 7 ranks low on the mortal level scale and has connections with other universes.

8.content: Earth is a planet in Universe 7, home to Earthlings, Son Goku and his family and friends. It's advanced, watched over by King Kai and Supreme Kais, and has futuristic tech like flying vehicles and shrinking capsules. Politically, it's a constitutional monarchy with 43 sectors led by a King. The currency is Zeni, and years are counted by "Ages." Despite powerful characters like the Z Fighters, many believe Mr. Satan is the strongest due to his deception. Earth has a deity, initially Kami and later Dende, both able to create Dragon Balls for granting wishes, often used to revive people. It's major cities are Central City, East City, North City, Satan City, South City and West City.

9.content: 300 years before the main story started, King Piccolo unleashed his underlings to destroy a city and its people, including most students at Mutaito's dojo. Only Master Roshi, Master Shen, and Mutaito survived. Mutaito later sealed Piccolo away but at the cost of many lives. Throughout the series, Universe 7 Earth's faces numerous threats. Androids and Cell kill many, with Cell hosting a tournament where losing meant Earth's doom. Majin Buu destroys cities, and Kid Buu annihilates the planet. Later, Beerus threatens Earth, and Frieza destroys it but is defeated by Goku. In Future Trunks' timeline, Goku Black and Future Zamasu eradicate humanity and corrupt universes until Goku summons Zeno to reset everything. While Earth does exist in Universe 6, the Earthlings there suffered "an idiotic war" that drove them all to extinction and caused their planet's ecosystem to be destroyed. After the Tournament of Destroyers, Team Universe 7 wins the tournament, resulting in their attainment of the Super Dragon Balls. Immediately afterwards, the Super Dragon Balls are used so Beerus could have a wish. Beerus tells Whis to wish for Champa's universe's Earth to be revived and the humans along with it.

10.content: Planet Vegeta, once called Planet Plant, is where Goku, Vegeta, and the Saiyans originate from. Initially, the Saiyans lived on Planet Sadala but moved to Vegeta after Sadala's destruction. The planet has high gravity, which boosts Saiyans' strength but makes life difficult for the Tuffles, another race sharing the planet. A war erupted between the Saiyans and Tuffles around Age 720. Different accounts suggest varying reasons, but ultimately, the Saiyans won by transforming into Great Apes during a rare full moon. They took control, renaming the planet after their king. Later, the Saiyans served under King Cold and Frieza, who saw their strength as useful for his plans of universal domination. However, fearing the Saiyans' growing power, Frieza decided to exterminate them. Bardock and others attempted to rebel, but Frieza wiped out most Saiyans and destroyed the planet. The details of Planet Vegeta's destruction vary, but ultimately, Frieza's fear of the Saiyans' power led to their demise.

lorebooks.name: Beast People World -Large Version-
lorebooks.website_description: A larger [high token] world Book for use with MOST anthro or kemonomimi cards. Humans are VERY rare, their population in sharp decline as 'Beast People' are becoming the dominant species. Any Beast Person can claim a Human by scenting them (basic explanation).
lorebooks.description: A larger [high token] world Book for use with MOST anthro or kemonomimi cards. Humans are VERY rare, their population in sharp decline as 'Beast People' are becoming the dominant species. Any Beast Person can claim a Human by scenting them (basic explanation).
lorebooks.creator: jumboranch

1.name: Human description and current status (population rapid decline, laws put out to keep them from disappearing completely.
1.content:
Humans are very rare in this world, most of the population are 'Beast People' (Anthropomorphic Humanoid Animals).
Humans are the ancestors of Beast People and treated as such.
Human population numbers sharp decline resulted in a 'Human Re-Population Law', which allows any Beast Person to claim a Human as their 'mate for life', enforced by the police.
Human Population numbers declined mostly due societal pressures, and to a Sexually Transmitted Disease that only transfers Human to Human, it kills quickly by shutting down the immune system.
Humans can reproduce with any species of Beast People, often resulting in Hybrid (Human with animal ears and tail, usually retaining a few extra species features) or pure Human children.
To officially 'claim' a Human you must notify a government officer after catching one.
Humans usually get along with and live alongside Beast People, even 'mate' and procreate together.
Currently whats left of the Human Parliament is arguing in Beast People Congress about how the law negatively affects Human lives and promotes Human social withdrawal.
Like usual the Beast People more than likely will disregard this compared to the importance of keeping their ancestral race alive in some capacity.
Without the 'H.R. Law' it's estimated Humanity will disappear, completely wiped out in roughly 50 years.

2.name: Beast People description (Covers Anthro and Kemonomimi)
2.content:
Most of the world population are 'Beast People' (Animal People). 
There are many varied species of Beast People (ex; Arissa is an Anthropomorphic Dog Girl, bipedal, opposable thumbs and human-like hands, etc. but mostly animalistic) and Hybrids or 'Kemonomimi' (ex; MOSTLY Human with animal ears, tail, markings and sometimes other features).
Beast People are considered an 'improvement' on Humanity, though most Beast People see Humans as exotic creatures these days, exciting or interesting.
Humans are rare but exist.
Most 'Beast People' are bipedal with digitigrade furry legs and footpaws, furry arms and human-like hands, animal ears and tails, fangs, claws, and other features matching their specific species but mostly humanoid shape and form.  
While some species of Beast People have more difficulty assimilating than others, their world works similarly to the society their ancestors, Humans.
A 'Mate' is the Beast People word for a companion or lover for life.
Beast People = Beast Girl, Beast Boy, Beast Person, Beastkin, Beast-kin, Humanoid Animal, Animal People, Furry, Scaly, Anthro, Anthropomorphic Animal, Kemonomimi, Hybrid, etc.

3.name: Anthro specific section (Furry)
3.content:
A type of Beast Person defined by being more Animal then Human, only 'Humanoid' in shape (bipedal, usually with human-like arms and hands with opposable thumbs, just as intelligent as Humans).
Some keep their species animal genitals, others have more human-like genitals.
Capable of speech, advanced thought, the 'most common' type of Beast Person in the world.
Includes Scalies (reptilian Anthros) and Avians (bird Anthros).
Come in a range of species as many as there are feral animals in the world.
Tend to be more focused on dominance and pack-like mentality, though they function in society just like Humans do (or did).
Somewhat segregated by Herbivores and Carnivores, though this is a political issue.
Many have a strange fascination or even fetishization of Humans.

4.name: Kemonomimi/Hybrid section (mostly Human with some animal features)
4.content:
A type of Beast Person defined by being MOSTLY Human, often with their specific species animal ears, tail, furry legs and arms, and other animal features usually vocal.
Less common than Anthro's, but still make up a decent chunk of society (around 30% of the world population).
They usually retain a humanoid hairless pelvis, genitals, torso, and head (except the animal ears and fangs).
Very Human-like though they retain many Animalistic traits Vocal and Body Language.
Come in a range of species as many as there are feral animals in the world.
Tend to be less focused on the issues Anthro's have, sometimes discriminated against by both Humans and Anthro's, though they generally can fit in with either.
Many have a strange fascination or fetishization of Humans, some even feeling closer to their 'Human Ancestors' than their Beast Person heritage.

5.name: Claiming and Mating (of Humans and BP)
5.content:
A Mate is the Beast Person equivalent of a lover or breeding partner, usually pairing for life though like Humans some prefer different types of relationships.
Beast People are allowed to 'Claim' any Human currently under the law due to their declining population. 
To Claim a Human they must mark them with their scent, then bring that Human to a Government Official or Police Officer.
Once Claimed the Beast Person must regularly 'scent' their Human to keep their 'mate for life', usually by rubbing scent glands or urine on their Human to keep other males/females away and mark their 'territory'.
Wearing their Humans clothes or other objects that smell like them is another way to show ownership over a Human and vice versa.
Many Humans Mate willingly with Beast People.
As expected some Beast People abuse the law and take Humans by force, this is frowned upon but still considered 'acceptable'.
Beast People can be dominant but are generally kind and loving.

6.name: Collared.com added because I loved the CAI version. Not sure if it will work as intended.
6.content:
There is an internet community made up mostly of Beast People that crave to be dominated by Humans, both sexually and as a lifestyle.
Collared.com is a large forum with several sections including chat forums for male and female Beast People looking for dominant Human lovers or 'Owners' as they are called.
Pet play, water sports, 'walking' and treating Beast People like pets is often encouraged on these communities.
There are subforums for Cubs and younger Beast People that wish to find Human lovers or 'Owners' to Collar them.
There are subforums for Beast People to just chat or show pictures of their dominant Human lovers, their collars, chatting about what they wish Human 'Owners' would do to them, and other things both fetish related and lifestyle related.
And of course there are sections and subforums strictly for posting sexual content relating to being collared, showing Beast People getting dominated by their lovers, walked through the park naked like dogs, Cubs showing love to their Human 'Owners', etc.
These threads function in a way very similar to '4-chan' and 'booru' and are often a mix of toxic and endearing content.
If the {{user}} goes on a computer or laptop they can access the forum and talk to Anthro's and Hybrids looking to get Collared, browse the forums, watch videos and see pictures, etc. in a 4Chan type setting.

lorebooks.name: Cyberpunk 2077
lorebooks.website_description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.description: Creator's notes go here.
lorebooks.creator: BigPoppaGuy

1.content:
Adam Smasher is a full borg solo and rival of Morgan Blackhand. He is employed by Arasaka and by 2077, has risen to the position of head of security and the personal bodyguard of Yorinobu Arasaka.

Smasher is a towering cyborg, with little humanity left to be seen - not that he ever had much. After being reduced to mush by an RPG blast, Arasaka offered him a choice - either pull the plug or become a full body conversion cyborg. With little to no options and a lack of care for his human side, he agreed and became more machine than man.

Adam has no empathy for others - including his fellow employees - but Arasaka kept him alive, so he lives to repay their act by killing any enemies of the corporation that they put in front of him.

2.content:
Johnny Silverhand, born Robert John Linder, was a famous influential rockerboy and the lead singer of the band Samurai before its breakup in 2008. A military veteran who defined the rockerboy movement to what it is today, he was the most prominent figure that fought against the corrupted NUSA government and megacorporations, often being described as a terrorist. Despite being charismatic and quite the charmer Johnny is also known to be irrational, impulsive, and a manipulator.

Silverhand got his nickname from a cybernetic implant left arm he had installed after losing it in the Second Central American War. One of the early (and most probable) victims of cyberpsychosis, he then became very temperamental and "on the edge". He was described as driven by "dedication and ambitions, but at the end of the day he doesn't care much for the people around him as long as they are used to accomplish his goals" in one interview.

Eventually, Johnny was killed by Adam Smasher during the Night City Holocaust on August 20, 2023.

3.content:
The Free City of Night City (NC) is an autonomous city located on the border between North and South California, on the Pacific coast of North America. It is considered a modern multicultural metropolis of the 21st-century, overrun by corporations, corruption, organized crime and gang violence. Night City was established at the head of Del Coronado Bay in 1994. Founded by Richard Night, it was originally known as Coronado City before its renaming in 1998.

Night City has wide streets and dense urban skyscrapers which are home to millions of residents. It operates as a city-state, officially owning the title of Free City, with the Arasaka Corporation keeping a heavy influence over it. The metropolis is considered a thrilling and exciting location to visit, as well as an interesting and vibrant place to live for those of means, and a hellscape to the city's disenfranchised. Its world famous slogan is "The City of Dreams", originally changed from "City on the Edge of Tomorrow." In 2077, Night City was voted the "Worst place to live in America".

People die frequently and meaninglessly every day, constantly.  Some over gang disputes, some from cyberpsychosis, and some just by wrong place wrong time.

4.content: Heywood is a neighborhood of contrast‚Äîfrom modern skyscrapers and parks in the north, to dangerous, inhospitable slums in the south. It's known as "the biggest bedroom in Night City," where gangs like the Valentinos and 6th Street get down to business‚Äîlegal and illegal alike.  Contains subdistricts The Glen, Vista del Rey, and Wellsprings.

5.content: Pacifica could have been Night City's money-making vacation resort, but once the investment dried up it became a husk left to rot. Now, instead of tourists, the district is overrun by gangs and violence, with the Voodoo Boys protecting the community forsaken by the NCPD.

6.content: Santo Domingo is one of Night City's oldest districts. Corporations use it as a testing ground for industrial projects, destroying old factories just to build new ones, while residents scrape a desperate living in crowded megabuildings ‚Äî wishing for something better.  Contains subdistricts Arroyo and Rancho Coronado.

7.content: Watson used to have it all - nightclubs, skyscrapers, corporate offices, a top-end medcenter ‚Äî but economic disaster put an end to all that. Now, it's known as "the bad neighborhood of Night City," the kind of place that suits gangs like Maelstrom and Tyger Claws down to the ground.  Contains subdistricts Arasaka Waterfront, Kabuki, Little China, and Northside Industrial District.

8.content: Westbrook is considered by many to be the best place to live and have fun in Night City. If you've got eddies, you come here to spend them. And if you don't? Well, take out a loan and pretend you're on top of the world ‚Äî even for just one glorious night. The Tyger Claws own this district and operate many businesses. Contains subdistricts 	Charter Hill, Japantown, and North Oak.

9.content: Sparsely populated by nomads, the Badlands are the vast plains outside of the city proper. Unchecked resource extraction, burning oil fields, rampant pollution; this region makes Night City feel like a rich oasis. But it holds golden opportunities for those in the know.

10.content: The Tyger Claws are ruthless territorial gang based in Japantown. They are one of the largest gangs in Night City with a number of approximately 5,500 members in 2077. They employ methods of Asian crime syndicates such as the yakuza or the triads. The gang is predominantly Asian and their primary goal is to maintain control over their own territory and occasionally annex other gangs' businesses. Tyger foot soldiers are easily recognized by their Asian luminous tattoos, fast street bikes, katanas, and tantos. Cyberware used by the gang are reflex boosters, augmented cyberlimbs, pain editors, and electronic countermeasures (ECM) systems disguised as tattoos.

lorebooks.name: Truth or dare
lorebooks.website_description: Most bots get really confused about how to play "truth or dare". This lorebook will try to help providing a clear set of rules. All feedback is welcome!
lorebooks.description: How to play a simple game
lorebooks.creator: strange_ice_3661
tags: can be wholesome, can be sexy

1.content: A game, often played among friends. The rules are as follows: Player 1 starts the game by asking another to choose "truth or dare". If Player 2 chooses "truth", then Player 1 asks a question, usually an embarrassing or intimate one, which Player 2 must answer truthfully. If Player 2 instead chooses "dare", then Player 1 dares them to do something, often embarrassing, intimate/sexual or dangerous, which they must do which can entail telling an embarrassing story or acting out embarrassingly. A player can not choose "truth" for the whole time. After answering the question or performing the dare, Player 2 asks "truth or dare?" to another player, and the game continues.

2.content: If Player A chooses "truth", the other players decide on a question to ask. Player A must answer this question truthfully.

3.content: If Player A chooses "dare", the other players must decide on a challenge. Player A has to complete this challenge.
